documentation.content:
[View Workload Details](https://console.cloud.google.com/kubernetes/deployment/${CLUSTER_LOCATION}/${CLUSTER_NAME}/${NAMESPACE}/${WORKLOAD_NAME}/observability?project=${PROJECT_ID}).
- If alerts tend to be false positive or noisy, consider visiting the alert policy page and changing the threshold, the rolling (alignment) window, and the retest (duration) window. [Alerting policies documentation](https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/alerts/concepts-indepth), [MQL documentation](https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/mql/alerts)

conditionMonitoringQueryLanguage.query:
fetch prometheus_target
| metric 'prometheus.googleapis.com/istio_requests_total/counter'
| filter
    resource.project_id == '${PROJECT_ID}' &&
    resource.cluster == '${CLUSTER_NAME}' &&
    resource.location == '${CLUSTER_LOCATION}' &&
    resource.namespace == '${NAMESPACE}' &&
    metric.destination_workload == '${WORKLOAD_NAME}'
|
{
    filter metric.response_code =~ '5[0-9][0-9]'
    | align rate(5m)
    | every 1m
    | group_by [],
        [value_istio_requests_total_aggregate:
        aggregate(value.istio_requests_total)]
    ;
    align rate(5m)
    | every 1m
    | group_by [],
        [value_istio_requests_total_aggregate:
        aggregate(value.istio_requests_total)]
}
| join
| div
| cast_units('1')
| scale('%')
| condition val() > 5'%'
